title: Stabilization of Antiferroelectric Nanodomains by Local Chemical Disorder Determined using Multislice Electron Ptychography
content: Antiferroelectric (AFE) perovskite oxides, with their unique dielectric and piezoelectric properties and chemical tunability, offer promising applications in energy storage [1]. Manipulating the AFE phase, however, presents a challenge due to the complex relationship between chemical and structural environments in these otherwise highly ordered materials. To better understand these factors, scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) has proven to be invaluable, offering a local probe of polar displacements and chemistry in a wide variety of AFE/FE materials [2, 3]. Despite this, characterization of extremely nanoscale phenomena or subtle structural perturbations is often limited by projection of the three-dimensional (3D) sample in STEM [4, 5].
